* Duke main class. This is the entry point for the Duke program.
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* Represents a Deadline task with a specific due date.
* @param name   the name of the deadline task
* @param isDone whether the task is marked as done or not
* @param by     the due date of the task
public Deadline(String name, boolean isDone, String by) {
* Overrides the toString method to display the task's details as a string.
* @return a formatted string representation of the task's details
* Overrides the print method to print the task details in a specific format.
* Event class represents an event task with a start time and a finish time.
* It extends the Task class and adds the startTime and finishTime attributes.
* Constructs an Event object with a name, completion status, start time, and
* @param name       the name of the event task
* @param isDone     the completion status of the event task
* @param startTime  the start time of the event task
* @param finishTime the finish time of the event task
public Event(String name, boolean isDone, String startTime, String finishTime) {
* Returns a string representation of the event task with its completion status,
* name, start time, and finish time.
* If the task is completed, the completion status is marked with an 'X',
* otherwise it is marked with a space.
* @return a string representation of the event task
* Prints the string representation of the event task with a dot prefix.
* The Parser class is responsible for parsing the user's input command and
* Parses the user's input command and executes the corresponding actions.
* @param listOfItems the TaskManager that stores the user's tasks
* @param ui          the Ui object that handles the program's output
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs
public static void handleCmd(String userCmd, TaskManager listOfItems, Ui ui) throws IOException {
* Returns the first word of a given string.
* @return the first word of the string
* Executes the "todo" command by adding a new Todo task to the TaskManager.
* @param listOfItems the TaskManager that stores the user's tasks
* @param ui          the Ui object that handles the program's output
public static void executeAddTodo(String s, TaskManager listOfItems, Ui ui) {
System.out.println("Roger. The following todo has been added:");
System.out.println("You now have " + listOfItems.getSize() + " item in the list");
System.out.println("Missing todo item. Please read instructions again");
* Adds a new Deadline task to the list of tasks.
* @param s           The string representation of the task to be added.
* @param listOfItems The TaskManager object that holds the list of tasks.
* @param ui          The UI object that interacts with the user.
public static void executeAddDeadline(String s, TaskManager listOfItems, Ui ui) {
System.out.println("Extra deadline found! Please try again!");
System.out.println("Roger. The following deadline has been added:");
System.out.println("You now have " + listOfItems.getSize() + " item in the list");
System.out.println("Your task name is missing please try again!");
System.out.println("Your deadline is missing please try again!");
* Adds a new Event task to the list of tasks.
* @param s           The string representation of the task to be added.
* @param listOfItems The TaskManager object that holds the list of tasks.
* @param ui          The UI object that interacts with the user.
public static void executeAddEvent(String s, TaskManager listOfItems, Ui ui) {
System.out.println("Roger. The following event has been added:");
System.out.println("You now have " + listOfItems.getSize() + " item in the list");
System.out.println("Your task name is missing please try again!");
System.out.println("Something is wrong with your event's start time or finish time please try again!");
* Storage class deals with saving and loading TaskManager class.
* Loads data from a file into the given TaskManager object.
* @param listOfItems The TaskManager object to load the data into.
* @return The TaskManager object with the loaded data.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the file to load from is not found.
public static TaskManager loadFile(TaskManager listOfItems) throws FileNotFoundException {
* Loads a Todo item from a string and adds it to the given TaskManager object.
* @param listOfItems The TaskManager object to add the Todo item to.

public static void loadTodo(TaskManager listOfItems, String l) {

* @throws IOException If there is something wrong with saving the file
public static void saveFile(TaskManager listOfItems) throws IOException {
The Task class represents a task with a name, a completion status, and a task type.
* Returns the completion status of the task.
* @return a boolean representing the completion status of the task.
* Returns the type of the task.
* @return a char representing the type of the task.
* Sets the type of the task.
* @param taskType a char representing the type of the task.
* Creates a new task with a given name and completion status.
* @param name a String representing the name of the task.
* @param isDone a boolean representing the completion status of the task.
* Returns the name of the task.
* @return a String representing the name of the task.
* Sets the name of the task.
* @param name a String representing the name of the task.
* Returns the completion status of the task.
* @return a boolean representing the completion status of the task.
* Returns the completion status of the task.
* @return a boolean representing the completion status of the task.
* Sets the completion status of the task.
* @param isDone a boolean representing the completion status of the task.
* Returns a String representation of the task.
* Prints the task to the console.
* Searches the name of the task for a given String.
* @param s a String representing the search query.
* @return a boolean indicating whether the search query was found in the name
* This class represents a task manager that stores and manages tasks.
* Finds a task in the list of tasks that contains the given string.
* If a matching task is found, its details are printed.
* If no matching task is found, a message is printed.
* @param s The string to search for in the task names.
System.out.println("Sorry there is no match for your search !");

* Marks the task with the given ID as done.
* @param id The ID of the task to mark as done.
System.out.println("This item has been marked as done!");
* Unmarks the task with the given ID as done.
* @param id The ID of the task to unmark as done.
System.out.println("The item has been marked as NOT done!");
* Lists all the tasks in the task manager.
* Deletes a task at the specified index.
* @param id The index of the task to be deleted.
* Gets the size of the task list.
* @return The size of the task list.
* Clears all tasks from the task list.
* Gets the task at the specified index.

* This class manages the UI for Duke
* Print the Input guidelines for the reader such that Duke understands the
System.out.println("todo + \"task name\" to add a task");
System.out.println("deadline + \"task name\" + /by \"task deadline\" to add a task with a deadline");
"event + \"event name\" + /from \"event start time\" + /to \"event finish time\" to add an event with a stant and finish time");
System.out.println("list to list all events and tasks available");
System.out.println("mark + \"task number\" to mark an item");
System.out.println("unmark + \"task number\" to unmark an item");
System.out.println("delete + \"task number\" to remove an item");
System.out.println("clear to clear all data in the hard drive");
System.out.println("find + \"phrase\" to find an item containing the phrase");
* Print the Horizontal Line that seperates between different user Inputs
* Print the message for user to signal that Duke cannot understand the input
System.out.println("Sorry Duke could not understand your input :> please follow the instructions");
* Print the Greeting when Duke is started
System.out.println("What can I do for you ?");
* Print the Goodbye message when user exits Duke
System.out.println("Thanks for using Duke! See ya!");
